alert.note: Alert for Crane; Pecos (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 01 at 7:58PM CDT until May 01 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland/Odessa has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Pecos County in southwestern Texas... Southeastern Crane County in western Texas... * Until 1000 PM CDT. * At 758 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Girvin. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
